controllers.smc.algorithms.adaptive.config¶

Source: src\controllers\smc\algorithms\adaptive\config.py

Module Overview¶

Configuration Schema for Adaptive SMC.

Type-safe configuration for Adaptive Sliding Mode Control with online gain adaptation. Replaces parameter validation from the original 427-line monolithic controller.

Complete Source Code¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#================= src/controllers/smc/algorithms/adaptive/config.py ==================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Configuration Schema for Adaptive SMC.
  7
  8Type-safe configuration for Adaptive Sliding Mode Control with online gain adaptation.
  9Replaces parameter validation from the original 427-line monolithic controller.
 10"""
 11
 12from typing import List
 13from dataclasses import dataclass, field
 14import numpy as np
 15
 16
 17@dataclass(frozen=True)
 18class AdaptiveSMCConfig:
 19    """
 20    Type-safe configuration for Adaptive SMC controller.
 21
 22    Based on adaptive SMC theory:
 23    - Surface gains [k1, k2, λ1, λ2] must be positive for Hurwitz stability
 24    - Adaptation rate γ must be positive but bounded for stability
 25    - Adaptation bounds [K_min, K_max] ensure bounded gains
 26    """
 27
 28    # Required parameters
 29    gains: List[float] = field()                           # [k1, k2, lam1, lam2, gamma]
 30    max_force: float = field()                             # Control saturation limit
 31    dt: float = field()                                    # Control timestep
 32
 33    # Adaptation parameters
 34    leak_rate: float = field(default=0.1)                  # Leakage for parameter drift
 35    adapt_rate_limit: float = field(default=100.0)        # Maximum adaptation rate
 36    K_min: float = field(default=0.1)                     # Minimum adaptive gain
 37    K_max: float = field(default=100.0)                   # Maximum adaptive gain
 38    K_init: float = field(default=10.0)                   # Initial adaptive gain
 39    alpha: float = field(default=0.5)                     # Adaptation law parameter
 40
 41    # Boundary layer and switching
 42    boundary_layer: float = field(default=0.01)           # Chattering reduction
 43    smooth_switch: bool = field(default=True)             # Use smooth switching
 44    dead_zone: float = field(default=0.01)                # Dead zone for adaptation
 45
 46    def __post_init__(self):
 47        """Validate configuration after creation."""
 48        self._validate_gains()
 49        self._validate_adaptation_parameters()
 50        self._validate_other_parameters()
 51
 52    def _validate_gains(self) -> None:
 53        """Validate gain vector according to adaptive SMC theory."""
 54        if len(self.gains) != 5:
 55            raise ValueError("Adaptive SMC requires exactly 5 gains: [k1, k2, lam1, lam2, gamma]")
 56
 57        # Check for NaN or infinite values first
 58        if not all(np.isfinite(g) for g in self.gains):
 59            invalid_indices = [i for i, g in enumerate(self.gains) if not np.isfinite(g)]
 60            gain_names = ['k1', 'k2', 'lam1', 'lam2', 'gamma']
 61            invalid_names = [gain_names[i] for i in invalid_indices]
 62            raise ValueError(f"Gains contain NaN or infinite values: {invalid_names}")
 63
 64        k1, k2, lam1, lam2, gamma = self.gains
 65
 66        # Surface gains must be positive for Hurwitz stability
 67        if any(g <= 0 for g in [k1, k2, lam1, lam2]):
 68            raise ValueError("Surface gains [k1, k2, λ1, λ2] must be positive for stability")
 69
 70        # Check for very small gains that might cause numerical issues
 71        if any(g < 1e-12 for g in [k1, k2, lam1, lam2]):
 72            raise ValueError("Surface gains are too small (minimum: 1e-12) which may cause numerical instability")
 73
 74        # Adaptation rate must be positive
 75        if gamma <= 0:
 76            raise ValueError("Adaptation rate γ must be positive")
 77        if gamma < 1e-12:
 78            raise ValueError("Adaptation rate γ is too small (minimum: 1e-12) which may cause numerical instability")
 79
 80        # Warn if adaptation rate is too large
 81        if gamma > 1.0:
 82            import warnings
 83            warnings.warn("Large adaptation rate may cause instability", UserWarning)
 84
 85    def _validate_adaptation_parameters(self) -> None:
 86        """Validate adaptation-specific parameters."""
 87        if self.leak_rate < 0 or self.leak_rate > 1:
 88            raise ValueError("leak_rate must be in [0, 1]")
 89
 90        if self.adapt_rate_limit <= 0:
 91            raise ValueError("adapt_rate_limit must be positive")
 92
 93        if self.K_min <= 0:
 94            raise ValueError("K_min must be positive")
 95
 96        if self.K_max <= self.K_min:
 97            raise ValueError("K_max must be greater than K_min")
 98
 99        if self.K_init < self.K_min or self.K_init > self.K_max:
100            raise ValueError("K_init must be in [K_min, K_max]")
101
102        if self.alpha <= 0 or self.alpha > 1:
103            raise ValueError("alpha must be in (0, 1]")
104
105        if self.dead_zone < 0:
106            raise ValueError("dead_zone must be non-negative")
107
108    def _validate_other_parameters(self) -> None:
109        """Validate other configuration parameters."""
110        if self.max_force <= 0:
111            raise ValueError("max_force must be positive")
112
113        if self.dt <= 0:
114            raise ValueError("dt must be positive")
115
116        if self.boundary_layer <= 0:
117            raise ValueError("boundary_layer must be positive")
118
119    @property
120    def k1(self) -> float:
121        """Joint 1 position gain."""
122        return self.gains[0]
123
124    @property
125    def k2(self) -> float:
126        """Joint 2 position gain."""
127        return self.gains[1]
128
129    @property
130    def lam1(self) -> float:
131        """Joint 1 velocity gain (λ₁)."""
132        return self.gains[2]
133
134    @property
135    def lam2(self) -> float:
136        """Joint 2 velocity gain (λ₂)."""
137        return self.gains[3]
138
139    @property
140    def gamma(self) -> float:
141        """Adaptation rate (γ)."""
142        return self.gains[4]
143
144    @property
145    def adaptation_rate(self) -> float:
146        """Adaptation rate for compatibility."""
147        return self.gamma
148
149    @property
150    def adaptation_rate_array(self) -> List[float]:
151        """Adaptation rate as array for 3-DOF system."""
152        return [self.gamma, self.gamma, self.gamma]
153
154    @property
155    def uncertainty_bound(self) -> float:
156        """Uncertainty bound for adaptation law."""
157        return self.K_init  # Use initial gain as uncertainty bound for test compatibility
158
159    @property
160    def initial_estimates(self) -> List[float]:
161        """Initial uncertainty estimates."""
162        return [self.K_init, self.K_init, self.K_init]  # 3-DOF system
163
164    def get_surface_gains(self) -> List[float]:
165        """Get sliding surface gains [k1, k2, λ1, λ2]."""
166        return self.gains[:4]
167
168    def get_adaptation_bounds(self) -> tuple[float, float]:
169        """Get adaptation bounds (K_min, K_max)."""
170        return (self.K_min, self.K_max)
171
172    def to_dict(self) -> dict:
173        """Convert configuration to dictionary."""
174        return {
175            'gains': list(self.gains),
176            'max_force': self.max_force,
177            'dt': self.dt,
178            'leak_rate': self.leak_rate,
179            'adapt_rate_limit': self.adapt_rate_limit,
180            'K_min': self.K_min,
181            'K_max': self.K_max,
182            'K_init': self.K_init,
183            'alpha': self.alpha,
184            'boundary_layer': self.boundary_layer,
185            'smooth_switch': self.smooth_switch,
186            'dead_zone': self.dead_zone
187        }
188
189    @classmethod
190    def from_dict(cls, config_dict: dict) -> 'AdaptiveSMCConfig':
191        """Create configuration from dictionary."""
192        return cls(**config_dict)
193
194    @classmethod
195    def create_default(cls, gains: List[float], max_force: float = 100.0,
196                      dt: float = 0.01, **kwargs) -> 'AdaptiveSMCConfig':
197        """Create configuration with sensible defaults."""
198        return cls(
199            gains=gains,
200            max_force=max_force,
201            dt=dt,
202            **kwargs
203        )

Classes¶

AdaptiveSMCConfig¶

Type-safe configuration for Adaptive SMC controller.

Based on adaptive SMC theory:

  • Surface gains [k1, k2, λ1, λ2] must be positive for Hurwitz stability

  • Adaptation rate γ must be positive but bounded for stability

  • Adaptation bounds [K_min, K_max] ensure bounded gains

Source Code¶

  1@dataclass(frozen=True)
  2class AdaptiveSMCConfig:
  3    """
  4    Type-safe configuration for Adaptive SMC controller.
  5
  6    Based on adaptive SMC theory:
  7    - Surface gains [k1, k2, λ1, λ2] must be positive for Hurwitz stability
  8    - Adaptation rate γ must be positive but bounded for stability
  9    - Adaptation bounds [K_min, K_max] ensure bounded gains
 10    """
 11
 12    # Required parameters
 13    gains: List[float] = field()                           # [k1, k2, lam1, lam2, gamma]
 14    max_force: float = field()                             # Control saturation limit
 15    dt: float = field()                                    # Control timestep
 16
 17    # Adaptation parameters
 18    leak_rate: float = field(default=0.1)                  # Leakage for parameter drift
 19    adapt_rate_limit: float = field(default=100.0)        # Maximum adaptation rate
 20    K_min: float = field(default=0.1)                     # Minimum adaptive gain
 21    K_max: float = field(default=100.0)                   # Maximum adaptive gain
 22    K_init: float = field(default=10.0)                   # Initial adaptive gain
 23    alpha: float = field(default=0.5)                     # Adaptation law parameter
 24
 25    # Boundary layer and switching
 26    boundary_layer: float = field(default=0.01)           # Chattering reduction
 27    smooth_switch: bool = field(default=True)             # Use smooth switching
 28    dead_zone: float = field(default=0.01)                # Dead zone for adaptation
 29
 30    def __post_init__(self):
 31        """Validate configuration after creation."""
 32        self._validate_gains()
 33        self._validate_adaptation_parameters()
 34        self._validate_other_parameters()
 35
 36    def _validate_gains(self) -> None:
 37        """Validate gain vector according to adaptive SMC theory."""
 38        if len(self.gains) != 5:
 39            raise ValueError("Adaptive SMC requires exactly 5 gains: [k1, k2, lam1, lam2, gamma]")
 40
 41        # Check for NaN or infinite values first
 42        if not all(np.isfinite(g) for g in self.gains):
 43            invalid_indices = [i for i, g in enumerate(self.gains) if not np.isfinite(g)]
 44            gain_names = ['k1', 'k2', 'lam1', 'lam2', 'gamma']
 45            invalid_names = [gain_names[i] for i in invalid_indices]
 46            raise ValueError(f"Gains contain NaN or infinite values: {invalid_names}")
 47
 48        k1, k2, lam1, lam2, gamma = self.gains
 49
 50        # Surface gains must be positive for Hurwitz stability
 51        if any(g <= 0 for g in [k1, k2, lam1, lam2]):
 52            raise ValueError("Surface gains [k1, k2, λ1, λ2] must be positive for stability")
 53
 54        # Check for very small gains that might cause numerical issues
 55        if any(g < 1e-12 for g in [k1, k2, lam1, lam2]):
 56            raise ValueError("Surface gains are too small (minimum: 1e-12) which may cause numerical instability")
 57
 58        # Adaptation rate must be positive
 59        if gamma <= 0:
 60            raise ValueError("Adaptation rate γ must be positive")
 61        if gamma < 1e-12:
 62            raise ValueError("Adaptation rate γ is too small (minimum: 1e-12) which may cause numerical instability")
 63
 64        # Warn if adaptation rate is too large
 65        if gamma > 1.0:
 66            import warnings
 67            warnings.warn("Large adaptation rate may cause instability", UserWarning)
 68
 69    def _validate_adaptation_parameters(self) -> None:
 70        """Validate adaptation-specific parameters."""
 71        if self.leak_rate < 0 or self.leak_rate > 1:
 72            raise ValueError("leak_rate must be in [0, 1]")
 73
 74        if self.adapt_rate_limit <= 0:
 75            raise ValueError("adapt_rate_limit must be positive")
 76
 77        if self.K_min <= 0:
 78            raise ValueError("K_min must be positive")
 79
 80        if self.K_max <= self.K_min:
 81            raise ValueError("K_max must be greater than K_min")
 82
 83        if self.K_init < self.K_min or self.K_init > self.K_max:
 84            raise ValueError("K_init must be in [K_min, K_max]")
 85
 86        if self.alpha <= 0 or self.alpha > 1:
 87            raise ValueError("alpha must be in (0, 1]")
 88
 89        if self.dead_zone < 0:
 90            raise ValueError("dead_zone must be non-negative")
 91
 92    def _validate_other_parameters(self) -> None:
 93        """Validate other configuration parameters."""
 94        if self.max_force <= 0:
 95            raise ValueError("max_force must be positive")
 96
 97        if self.dt <= 0:
 98            raise ValueError("dt must be positive")
 99
100        if self.boundary_layer <= 0:
101            raise ValueError("boundary_layer must be positive")
102
103    @property
104    def k1(self) -> float:
105        """Joint 1 position gain."""
106        return self.gains[0]
107
108    @property
109    def k2(self) -> float:
110        """Joint 2 position gain."""
111        return self.gains[1]
112
113    @property
114    def lam1(self) -> float:
115        """Joint 1 velocity gain (λ₁)."""
116        return self.gains[2]
117
118    @property
119    def lam2(self) -> float:
120        """Joint 2 velocity gain (λ₂)."""
121        return self.gains[3]
122
123    @property
124    def gamma(self) -> float:
125        """Adaptation rate (γ)."""
126        return self.gains[4]
127
128    @property
129    def adaptation_rate(self) -> float:
130        """Adaptation rate for compatibility."""
131        return self.gamma
132
133    @property
134    def adaptation_rate_array(self) -> List[float]:
135        """Adaptation rate as array for 3-DOF system."""
136        return [self.gamma, self.gamma, self.gamma]
137
138    @property
139    def uncertainty_bound(self) -> float:
140        """Uncertainty bound for adaptation law."""
141        return self.K_init  # Use initial gain as uncertainty bound for test compatibility
142
143    @property
144    def initial_estimates(self) -> List[float]:
145        """Initial uncertainty estimates."""
146        return [self.K_init, self.K_init, self.K_init]  # 3-DOF system
147
148    def get_surface_gains(self) -> List[float]:
149        """Get sliding surface gains [k1, k2, λ1, λ2]."""
150        return self.gains[:4]
151
152    def get_adaptation_bounds(self) -> tuple[float, float]:
153        """Get adaptation bounds (K_min, K_max)."""
154        return (self.K_min, self.K_max)
155
156    def to_dict(self) -> dict:
157        """Convert configuration to dictionary."""
158        return {
159            'gains': list(self.gains),
160            'max_force': self.max_force,
161            'dt': self.dt,
162            'leak_rate': self.leak_rate,
163            'adapt_rate_limit': self.adapt_rate_limit,
164            'K_min': self.K_min,
165            'K_max': self.K_max,
166            'K_init': self.K_init,
167            'alpha': self.alpha,
168            'boundary_layer': self.boundary_layer,
169            'smooth_switch': self.smooth_switch,
170            'dead_zone': self.dead_zone
171        }
172
173    @classmethod
174    def from_dict(cls, config_dict: dict) -> 'AdaptiveSMCConfig':
175        """Create configuration from dictionary."""
176        return cls(**config_dict)
177
178    @classmethod
179    def create_default(cls, gains: List[float], max_force: float = 100.0,
180                      dt: float = 0.01, **kwargs) -> 'AdaptiveSMCConfig':
181        """Create configuration with sensible defaults."""
182        return cls(
183            gains=gains,
184            max_force=max_force,
185            dt=dt,
186            **kwargs
187        )

Methods (18)¶

__post_init__(self)¶

Validate configuration after creation.

View full source →

_validate_gains(self)¶

Validate gain vector according to adaptive SMC theory.

View full source →

_validate_adaptation_parameters(self)¶

Validate adaptation-specific parameters.

View full source →

_validate_other_parameters(self)¶

Validate other configuration parameters.

View full source →

k1(self)¶

Joint 1 position gain.
